testCases.name: test_case_141
testCases.input: When dividing the strata of a region, it is generally to establish a___________ Section. All sections with complete stratigraphic exposure, normal sequence, clear contact relationship and well preserved fossils can be used as___________ Section. If it is marine strata, it often shows repeated changes of lithofacies from coarse to fine and from fine to coarse. Such a change is called a deposit ___________, That is, each set of transgressive horizon and regressive horizon constitutes a complete sedimentary ___________. Strata can also be divided according to lithology. The lithologic change reflects the sedimentation to a certain extent___________ Changes, while deposition___________ The change of the earth's crust is often closely related to the crustal movement. Therefore, the strata are divided into many units according to lithology, which can basically represent the development stage of local geological history________ and
testCases.actualOutput:
### Answer:
When dividing the strata of a region, it is generally to establish a **typical** Section. All sections with complete stratigraphic exposure, normal sequence, clear contact relationship and well preserved fossils can be used as **typical** Section.
